problem.statementHtml: Find the expectation of a discrete random variable X with values {1, 2, 3} and probabilities {0.4, 0.3, 0.3}, respectively.
hints: Start by identifying the possible values and their corresponding probabilities.
problem.solutionHtml:
Step 1: Identify the possible values and their corresponding probabilities.

\[x_1 = 1, P(X=1) = 0.4; x_2 = 2, P(X=2) = 0.3; x_3 = 3, P(X=3) = 0.3\]

Step 2: Multiply each value by its probability.

\[1 \cdot 0.4 + 2 \cdot 0.3 + 3 \cdot 0.3 = 1.2 + 0.6 + 0.9 = 3.7\]

Step 3: Calculate the expectation.

\[\mathbb{E}[X] = \sum_{i} x_i P(X=x_i) = 3.7\]

problem.statementHtml: Find the expectation of a discrete random variable X that takes values {0, 1, 2} with probabilities {0.4, 0.3, 0.3}, respectively.
problem.solutionHtml:
Solution:

  • Step 1: Identify the possible values and their corresponding probabilities: \[\{x_0=0, P(X=0)=0.4\}, \{x_1=1, P(X=1)=0.3\}, \{x_2=2, P(X=2)=0.3\}.
  • Step 2: Plug in the values and probabilities into the expectation formula:

    • \[\mathbb{E}[X] = 0 \cdot 0.4 + 1 \cdot 0.3 + 2 \cdot 0.3 = 0.9\]
